result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert W Stamp was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Case called at 3:28 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Robert W Stamp in court with Attorney Michael C. Witt. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Witt submits 2 letters in support of Defendant
Upon agreement of Counsel, Court orders disc to be sealed & to be marked as Not to be opened unless ordered by the Court
Court/Counsel discuss witness under subpoena/phone testimony-Upon record made by ADA Shock, Atty Witt indicates that witness will not be needed for testimony. Sentencing Arguments by Counsel
Court considers the events described by ADA Shock as having occurred on June 23rd, July 16th & August 9th, would not be subject to prosecution by the State as the Court is considering them today for purposes of sentencing and they will be treated as uncharged read-ins.

On Count #1, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 7 years, with conditions:
--serve 8 months in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/Work-release privileges for purposes of employment or any type of assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent & for any AODA Assessment as ordered in any OWI conviction; to commence forthwith
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--To undergo any assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--AODA Assessment & Follow-through as recommended per Agent
--To attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two, per Agent
--To pay costs of $268
--To pay $250 DNA Surcharge
--To pay $128 subpoena fees
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand
--Sex offender registration pursuant to 301.45
--No contact with HKT
--No contact or communication with any female under the age of 18 unless Agent approves, except for incidental contact in public setting

Days credit for time already served: 4 days - Court allows Counsel 30 days to file any changes to credit if deemed appropriate
Felony Firearm/Voting Prohibitions Warnings Form Given
Recess: 4:29 pm
Personal service made for Columbia County Dept of Health and Human Services w/copy of subpoena attached

Case called at 1:40 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Robert W Stamp in court with Attorney Michael C. Witt. ADA Jeffrey M. Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Witt indicates that there is no need to rule on pending motions as settlement has been reached

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Counts #2 & #3
Atty Witt requests adjournment in approx. 30 days, presents basis
ADA Shock: No objection
Court reminds Mr. Stamp that his bond/conditions of release remain in effect while case is pending

Court presents basis and AMENDS bond, upon stipulation of parties and requires $10,000 signature bond with conditions:
-Maintain absolute sobriety
-No consumption of alcohol or illegal drug
-No contact with any minor female (under 18 years of age)
-no contact with H.K.T. 
-not to communicate with any juvenile female over the Internet or by any other means of electronic communication 

Atty Witt requests to view video of interview prior to sentencing hearing - ADA Shock: No objection, but requests video be sealed in Court file
Court grants, presents basis and orders video (Mark as Recording of Victim's Statement) to be sealed once submitted
Court charges Atty Witt to file all material 1 week before sentencing hearing
Recess: 1:57 pm

case called at 1:16pm. 
Defendant Robert W Stamp appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa (PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 

The Defense waives Preliminary Hearing time limits, however the State requests a timely Preliminary Hearing. 

The Court requires a $10,000 bond, with conditions:
--no contact with H.K.T. 
--no physical contact with any juvenile female
--not to communicate with any juvenile female over the Internet or by any other means of electronic communication 

The Court instructs the clerk to follow up on making sure that the booking fingerprint-card is filed in the case file. 
recess 1:26pm. 

NEXT: Preliminary Hearing on 4/10/14 at 8:30am.
